DATATYPE.Description: A very small integer. The signed range is -128 to 127. The unsigned range is 0 to 255.
A small integer. The signed range is -32768 to 32767. The unsigned range is 0 to 65535.
A medium-size integer. The signed range is -8388608 to 8388607. The unsigned range is 0 to 16777215.
A normal-size integer. The signed range is -2147483648 to 2147483647. The unsigned range is 0 to 4294967295.
A normal-size integer. The signed range is -2147483648 to 2147483647. The unsigned range is 0 to 4294967295.
A large integer. The signed range is -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807. The unsigned range is 0 to 18446744073709551615.
A small (single-precision) floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Allowable values are -3.402823466E+38 to -1.175494351E-38, 0, and 1.175494351E-38 to 3.402823466E+38.
A small (single-precision) floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Allowable values are -3.402823466E+38 to -1.175494351E-38, 0, and 1.175494351E-38 to 3.402823466E+38.

A normal-size (double-precision) floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Allowable values are -1.7976931348623157E+308 to -2.2250738585072014E-308, 0, and 2.2250738585072014E-308 to 1.7976931348623157E+308.
This is a synonym for DOUBLE.
This is a synonym for DOUBLE.
An unpacked floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Behaves like a CHAR column.
This is a synonym for DECIMAL.
A date. The supported range is \a1000-01-01\a to \a9999-12-31\a.
A date and time combination. The supported range is \a1000-01-01 00:00:00\a to \a9999-12-31 23:59:59\a.
A timestamp. The range is \a1970-01-01 00:00:00\a to sometime in the year 2037. The length can be 14 (or missing), 12, 10, 8, 6, 4, or 2 representing YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, ... , YYYYMMDD, ... , YY formats.
A time. The range is \a-838:59:59\a to \a838:59:59\a.
A year in 2- or 4-digit format (default is 4-digit).

A fixed-length string (1 to 255 characters) that is always right-padded with spaces to the specified length when stored. values are sorted and compared in case-insensitive fashion according to the default character set unless the BINARY keyword is given.
A variable-length string (1 to 255 characters). Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion unless the BINARY keyword is given.
This is a synonym for CHAR(1).
This is a synonym for CHAR(1).
A column maximum length of 255 (2^8 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 65535 (2^16 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 16777215 (2^24 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 4294967295 (2^32 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 255 (2^8 - 1) characters.
A column maximum length of 65535 (2^16 - 1) characters.
A column maximum length of 16777215 (2^24 - 1) characters.
A column maximum length of 4294967295 (2^32 - 1) characters.
An enumeration. A string object that can have only one value, chosen from the list of values.
A set. A string object that can have zero or more values, each of which must be chosen from the list of values.
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype

REGION.Comments: The zedi region is the tables in the zedi database that are used by the Data Tracking System and the Master Lists.
The Master List region contains tables that will be included in the database containing the information specific to the Master Lists that are not in Jedi7.
The databases included in the DTS region are to be a part of the DTS database. It contains the information needed by the Data Tracking System that is not included in Jedi7.

TABLE.Comments: The user table fills two purposes. First, the user table defines the list of users that can actively edit (or have in the past) the DTS database. The active users will appear in the lists of the tools. The second pupose is for logging into the DTS system. This provides a way for tools to allow different users different abilitites.

COLUMN.Comments: The password (assigned using MD5 encyption) for the user
If the user is an active user of the DTS.

TABLE.Comments: The user_roles table defines the list of roles in the web applications that the user is able to perform. This defines users as viewers, editors, superusers, etc.

COLUMN.Comments: The name of the role being assigned to the user.

TABLE.Comments: The ingest_type table contains the list of possible forms that data is ingested.

COLUMN.Comments: A generated id number to define the ingest type.
The unique name for the ingest type.
The description of the ingest type.

TABLE.Comments: The dts_status table contains the list of possible statuses that can be assigned to a task for a dataset.

COLUMN.Comments: The generated identifier for the status.
The unique name for the status.
The CSS style to use when displaying the status.
The description of the status.
A flag that marks the status as resolved (finished).

TABLE.Comments: The dts.dataset table is the list of datasets that contain some DTS information. The table contains general DTS information that is relevant for every dataset that is entered into the system.

COLUMN.Comments: The type of the specified dataset.
The date when the dataset was entered into the DTS system.
A flag that marks if the dataset has documentation.
The status of the final approval of the dataset.

TABLE.Comments: The project table for the master list contains specific project information required for the master list that is not included in the Jedi7 database.

COLUMN.Comments: The project that is to have a master list

TABLE.Comments: The dataset_project table associates a project and dataset for the project\as master list. It references both the master list\as project and dataset tables to make sure that they both exist as master list entries and references the dataset_project table in zedi to make sure there is a valid dataset/project association in zedi as well.

COLUMN.Comments: The project being assigned a data set for the master list
The dataset to be included in the master list for the project
Flag to hide the dataset in the project\as master list.

TABLE.Comments: The dataset table is for holding dataset information that is not included in zedi, but needed for a master list.

COLUMN.Comments: The dataset to be included in a master list.

TABLE.Comments: The note table contains all of the notes for all of the entries in the DTS database. See associated tables on how notes align with datasets, projects, etc.

COLUMN.Comments: The generated identifier for the note.
The person who originally wrote the note.
The text of the note.
The date and time when the note was created.

TABLE.Comments: The note_type table contains the list of the type of notes allowed for the different groups notes can belong to. This would include entries for general, ingest, load, approve, and process for datasets along with general for both projects and groups.

COLUMN.Comments: The generated identifier for the note type.
The unique name of the note type for the group.
The group type the note type is being created for.
The description of the note type.

TABLE.Comments: The dataset_note table is used for assigning notes to datasets. It also specifies the type of note is being associated to the dataset.

COLUMN.Comments: The dataset that is being assigned a note
The note being assigned to a dataset
The type of the note being assigned

TABLE.Comments: The dataset_ingest table contains the DTS information on the ingest task.

COLUMN.Comments: The dataset that has ingest task information
The key for how the data for the data set was ingested
The id for the person who is assigned the ingest task
The id of the status for the ingesting of the dataset.
The directory path where the ingested data can be found.

TABLE.Comments: The dataset_load table contains the information for a dataset that has information about the load task.

COLUMN.Comments: The data set that has load task information.
The user who is assigned to the load task.
The id of the status of the load task.
The directory path where the data to be loaded can be found.
The directory path where the final archive data was loaded.

TABLE.Comments: The project table contains extra information on projects for the DTS that is not in Jedi7.

COLUMN.Comments: The project to include in the DTS
A flag that marks the project as active in the DTS.
The account number to be charged for work on the project.

TABLE.Comments: The project_note table associates notes with projects.

The dataset_group table is a collection of datasets for a project that have something in common. This could be a processing group that does not form a composite or a set of datasets that were ingested together.

COLUMN.Comments: The unique id of the group
The project for which the group is defined
The unique name of the group for the project
The status of the group

TABLE.Comments: The dataset_group_note table associates a dataset group with a note and type of note.

COLUMN.Comments: The group begin assigned a note
The note being assigned to a group
They type of the note begin assigned to the group

TABLE.Comments: The dataset_group_dataset table associates a dataset with a group.

COLUMN.Comments: The group being assigned a data set
The dataset being associated with a group
Flag that marks the dataset as excluded from the dataset group.

TABLE.Comments: The dataset_process table contains DTS dataset information that is relevant to the processing task. It contains work directories and where generated output files can be found.

COLUMN.Comments: The dataset that has process task information
The user who is assigned the process task
The status of the process task.
The directory where the processing was done
The directory where the final best data can be found
The URL where the plots of the processed data can be viewed
The directory where the best software for the processing is stored
The location of the station list file
The URL where the how to perform the conversion can be viewed
A flag that announces that there are questions about the processing

TABLE.Comments: The dataset_source_dataset associates a source dataset with a processed dataset.

COLUMN.Comments: The process data set that is being assigned a source data set
The source data set being assigned to a process data set
Flag to mark the source dataset as excluded from the processed dataset.

TABLE.Comments: The dataset_source_info is an extension of the dataset that that contains source information on the times for the collection of the data.

COLUMN.Comments: The data set that has source information
The timezone or number of offset from UTC for the data set
If the times of the data were recorded using DST
The notes on when the data was collected
Notes on where the info was received

RELATION.FKFieldsComments: The contact being assigned a role\n
The dataset id from zedi\n
The user who entered the dataset into the DTS\n
The user assigned the task of final approval of the dataset\n
The status for the approval task\n
The id of the project.\n
The dataset being associated with a note\n
The note being associated with a dataset\n
The type of note being associated to a data set\n
The dataset associated with an ingest task\n
The user assigned to the ingest task for a dataset\n
The key for the ingest task that specifes how the data was received for the data set\n
The id for a dataset that has load task data\n
The user who wrote the note\n
The user assigned the task of loading the dataset\n
The status assigned to the load task\n
The project being assigned a note\n
The note being associated to a project\n
The type of the note being assigned to the proejct\n
The project being assigned a dataset group\n
The dataset group being assigned a note\n
The note being assigned to a dataset group\n
The type of note being assigned to the dataset group\n
The dataset group being associated with a dataset\n
The status of the dataset group\n
The dataset being assigned processing data\n
The status of the processing for the dataset\n
The processed dataset being associated with a source dataset\n
The dataset being assigned information about the data\n
The source dataset being associated with a processed dataset\n
The user assigned the task of processing the dataset\n
The dataset being associated with the dataset group\n

NOTE.NoteText:
The DTS tables will also have
row_revise_contact_id and row_revise_time
attributes:

dataset,dataset_ingest,dataset_load,ingest_type,
note,note_type,project,status
